intro: Hieracium racemosum var. croceum, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in summer, are surrounded by pale green ray florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
